title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
હવે ગુજરધરમાં સંત ફરતા, કરતા હરિની વારતા; 
પંચવ્રતે પૂરા શૂરા, પ્રભુને સંભારતા.
gujarati.context: Saints are now wandering in Gujarat, singing the praises of God; They have fulfilled their five vows and surrendered to the Lord's will.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
તેણે મનમાં વિચારિયું, હજી નાથજી કેમ નાવિયા; 
આજ કાલ કરતાં, દર્શન વિના દિન બહુ ગિયા.
gujarati.context: The speaker thought deeply about why they didn't take the opportunity; today's time is fleeting, and many days have passed without seeing their loved one.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
એમ શોચ કરીને સંત સૂતા, તેને સ્વપ્નમાં આવ્યા હરિ; 
સખા સંગે શ્યામળો, જાણું પધાર્યા દયા કરી.
gujarati.context: The saintly soul wept and then had a divine revelation in their dream, where they saw God. Through this experience, they gained understanding and were filled with divine love.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
શ્વેત વસ્ત્ર પહેરી લેરી, જાણું આવિયા અશ્વે ચડી; 
સંત મન મગન થઈ, કહે ધન્ય ધન્ય આજ ઘડી.
gujarati.context: Wearing white clothes, I've come to know my true self; My heart is now at peace, and today is a fortunate day.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
એક કહે મહારાજને મેં, ગુંજાહાર પહેરાવિયા; 
બાજુ કાજુ કુંડળ કરી, ફૂલના તોરા ધરાવિયા.
gujarati.context: I've worn the garland of Maharaaj's words; On both sides, I've built a well, and placed the flowers' throne.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
એક કહે જાણું ચંદન ઘશી, ચરચ્યું મારા હાથશું; 
એક કહે જાણું અલબેલાને, ભેટિયો ભરી બાથશું.
gujarati.context: One says "I'll decorate the moon", I'll take my own hands; One says "I'll make Albelana", fill the vessel and bring it back myself.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
એક કહે જાણું નાથનાં, ચરણ છાપ્યાં છાતિએ; 
એક કહે એવી દીઠી મૂરતિ, તે તો નવ્ય જાય કહ્યે.
gujarati.context:
One says "I don't know" with lips sealed shut; 
Another says it's fate, a new path will unfold when spoken.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
એક કહે મેં સખા દીઠા, સંગે સુંદર શ્યામને; 
એમ સંતે સ્વપ્ન માંહી, દીઠા પૂરણ કામને.
gujarati.context: A friend and I met by chance, and together we found Shyam beautiful; in this dream, our unfinished tasks are complete.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
પ્રભાતે ઊઠી પરસ્પર, વાત કરવા લાગિયા; 
જાણ્યું પધાર્યા વાલ્યમો, સંત સહુનાં દુઃખ ભાંગિયાં.
gujarati.context: After waking up together, they wanted to talk; having known each other's troubles, they consoled each other's sorrow.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
પછી નાહી જન જીવનની, વાટ જુવે છે સહુ મળી; 
એમ કરતાં પધારિયા, વાલ્યમજી પોતે વળી.
gujarati.context: Life is not measured after death; it's the present moment that truly matters. One should live life to the fullest while they still can.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
જેવા દીઠાતા સ્વપ્ન માંઈ, તેવાના તેવા પધારિયા; 
દર્શન દઈ દાસને, નવલા તે નેહ વધારિયા.
gujarati.context:
As one dreams of their own desires, so they walk on that path; 
One sees the world anew, and it becomes even more beautiful.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
જન સહુ મગન થયા, નીર્ખી નટવર નાથને; 
પાય લાગી પાસળે, વળી ઊભા જોડી હાથને.
gujarati.context:
The people have become foolish and careless, neglecting to hold hands with those who are worth keeping close.

Their paths have diverged, and now they're left alone to wander without a guiding hand.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પ્રભુજી બોલિયા, જાઓ તેડાવો સર્વે જનને; 
સંતને ખબર કરજ્યો, મર કરે આવી દર્શનને.
gujarati.context: The Lord says, "Go and tell everyone; don't spare anyone." After death, the soul will show up in front of Saintly people to take account.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
પછી સાંભળીને સર્વે આવ્યા, સતસંગી ને સંત વળી; 
નાથ નીરખી હૈયે હરખી, લાગ્યા પાય પ્રભુને લળી.
gujarati.context: After a long search, good company and divine guidance were found; faith and devotion to God's lot were gained.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
સંત મંડળ સર્વે આવ્યાં, બેઠા જોઈ જીવનને; 
અલબેલે અમૃત દ્રષ્ટે, જોયા સર્વે જનને.
gujarati.context: The saints have gathered, and they behold life; They have seen all beings with the eyes of immortality.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
અનંત સુખ આપ્યાં વાલે, કાપ્યાં દુઃખ દાસ તણાં; 
મીઠી વાણ્યે બોલી મોહન, રાજી કર્યા સંત ઘણા.
gujarati.context: Endless happiness is obtained by those who let go of worldly desires, while suffering ensues for those who are attached to pleasure; sweet words from the Lord's lips bring peace and serenity.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
પછી દિવસ વળતે, આવી અવલ એકાદશી; 
સતસંગી નરનારી સહુ, રહ્યા વ્રત મળી ઋષિ.
gujarati.context: After a good day's work, one should come together with friends to share and enjoy; it is the path of righteousness to maintain this virtuous friendship.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
જેતલપુરની જાગ્યમાં, મનુષ્ય તો માયાં નહિ; 
પછી પ્રભુજી વિરાજિયા, તડાગતટે વટે જઈ.
gujarati.context: In the darkness of ignorance, a person is not even their own master; afterwards, only divine providence can set them free and lead them to the right path.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યાં અનંત જન આવિયા, લાવિયા પૂજા પ્રીતશું; 
અંબર ભૂષણ અંગે અરપી, ચરણ ચિતવ્યાં ચિત્તશું.
gujarati.context: There, countless people gathered, bearing reverence and devotion; under the shade of the mango tree, the soul was immersed in meditation.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
પછી સંત શીખંડ ઘસી, લાવ્યાતા ભાજન ભરી; 
મરજી જોઈ મહારાજની, સર્વે અંગમાં અરચા કરી.
gujarati.context: The saintly seekers are satisfied with the offerings they've made, and their souls have been freed from all worldly desires.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
સુંદર હાર સુમનના, પ્રભુને પહેરાવિયા; 
પોંચી બાજુ કાજુ કુંડળ, ગજરા તોરા ધરાવિયા.
gujarati.context: Beautiful hair is worn by the beloved, and God is pleased; similarly, a beautiful life is lived under the shelter of destiny's guidance.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
ધૂપ દીપ કરી આરતી, સહુ લળી પાયે લાગિયા; 
પછી પ્રભુજી ગામમાં, ઘોડે ચડી જમવા ગિયા.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a person's longing to leave their home, having ignited the lamp of desires and lit the path ahead, making them eager to embark on a new journey under God's guidance.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
જમી જીવન આવિયા, નાયા પછી નીરમાં; 
ચોળી ચંદન ઉતારિયું, જે ચરચ્યું હતું શરીરમાં.
gujarati.context: Life is but a fleeting moment, like water that flows away after being used; even the sweetest memories are eventually forgotten in our mortal bodies.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પહોર પાછલે, વાલો પધાર્યા વાડિયે; 
એમ સુખ અલબેલડો, દિયે દાસને દાડિદાડિયે.
gujarati.context: Life moves backward, memories move forward; that's the nature of happiness, as fleeting as a servant's attention.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
અનંત વાતો ત્યાં કરી, સુણી સંત સહુ મગન થિયા; 
પછી સખા સંગે શ્યામળો, મોલે મલપતા આવિયા.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a situation where one has exhausted their words and is left with nothing but silence; later, the same person's song becomes sweet and melodious.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
જને ત્યાં જાગરણ કર્યું, ગાયાં કીર્તન અતિ ઘણાં; 
પાટે બેસી પાતળે, સુણ્યાં પદ સંત તણાં.
gujarati.context: Where consciousness awakens, songs of devotion abound; The enlightened ones settle at the feet of their guru, their words being sacred and profound.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પ્રભુજી બોલિયા, તમે સાંભળો હરિજન સહુ; 
અતિ રહસ્ય એકાંત્યની, એક વાલ્યપની વાત કહું.
gujarati.context: The Lord spoke to you, listen well, O Harin; I will tell a secret tale of solitude and a hidden truth.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
આ સભામાં આપણ સહુનાં, તેજોમય તન છે; 
છટા છૂટે છે તેજની, જાણું પ્રકટિયા કોટિ ઇન્દુ છે.
gujarati.context: In this gathering, we are the sons of that mighty soul; its sparks are scattered, but we know it's hidden in a hundred thousand Indus rivers.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
વળી કહું એક વારતા, સર્વે કીધું આપણું થાય છે; 
સુખ દુઃખ વળી જય પરાજય, યત્કિંચિત્ જે કહેવાય છે.
gujarati.context: Life is a play that we all act in together; joy and sorrow are just roles we take, as fate decides what's written for us to say.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
જે જે આપણને નવ્ય ગમે, તે જીવ કેમ શકે કરી; 
જુવો સર્વે જક્તમાં, કોણ શકે છે ફેલ આચરી.
gujarati.context: As we enjoy new things, it's hard to let go; try to see everything in life and don't scatter your attention.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
વળી રીત્ય આપણી, જે જીવને નથી ગમતી; 
જોઉં છું એવા જીવને, છે કેની કેની એવી મતિ.
gujarati.context: The way of life that is not loved by us; I will follow such a life, and think it to be good in its own way.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
તેને શોધી સામટો, એક દંડ દેવા તાન છે; 
કોઈ ન પ્રીછે પરચો, એવું કરવું મારે નિદાન છે.
gujarati.context: He searches for a suitable mate, but his own stubbornness is the obstacle; no one prays to their fate, and that's what I've decided is my punishment.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
જેવું અમારાં અંગમાં, સુખદુઃખ રાખું છું સહી; 
તેવું જાણજ્યો જક્તમાં, કહું સત્ય એમાં સંશય નહિ.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
વળી આપણે રાખિયાં, ષટ રસનાં વ્રતમાન<RHYME_212040>; 
તે દિ સર્વે જક્તમાં, કેને ખાવા ન રહ્યું ધાન<RHYME_212040>.
gujarati.context:
We have kept the six rasas in our heart; 
The world may crave, but we shouldn't give it attention.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
જે દિ અમે છાના રહ્યા, અને વળી વધાર્યા કેશ<RHYME_212041>; 
તે દિના આ ભૂ વિષે, સહુ નિસ્તેજ થયા નરેશ<RHYME_212041>.
gujarati.context: On the days when we are carefree and our hair is long; those days become a distant memory, like a forgotten dream.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
વળી અમે અંગમાં, આણ્યો હતો મંદવાડ<RHYME_212042>; 
તે દાડે આ જક્તમાં, બહુ જીવનો ગયો બિગાડ<RHYME_212042>.
gujarati.context: We spent time in vain, and he took it away; many lives were ruined due to his carelessness.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
એમ જણાય છે એકતા, મારા પિંડ બ્રહ્માંડમાં મળી; 
જે હોય આ અંગમાં, તે બ્રહ્માંડમાં હોય વળી.
gujarati.context: Unity is understood as the oneness of all souls, which meet in the cosmic expanse. What exists within this body also exists in the universe.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
તે માટે તમે સાંભળો, સતસંગી સહુ નરનાર<RHYME_212043>; 
જે જે થાય છે જક્તમાં, તેનો બીજો નથી કરનાર<RHYME_212043>.
gujarati.context: For the sake of others, be a companion to good people; what happens in your heart, no one else can do anything about it.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
સુખ દુઃખ આવે સર્વે ભેળું, તેમાં રાખજ્યો સ્થિર મતિ; 
જાળવીશ મારા જનને, વળી કરીશ જતન અતિ.
gujarati.context: Happiness and sorrow come unexpectedly to all, so keep a steady mind. Cherish your family and never neglect their well-being.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરતાં જો પંડ પડશે, તો આગળ સુખ છે અતિ ઘણું; 
પણ વ્રત ટેક જો ટાળશો તો, ભોગવશો સહુ સહુ તણું.
gujarati.context: As you strive to achieve something great, then happiness is very near; but if you take a vow and fail, then suffer alone in sorrow.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
નહિ તો તમે નચિંત રહેજ્યો, કરવું તમારે કાંઈ નથી; 
જે મળ્યા છે તમને, તે પાર છે અક્ષરથી.
gujarati.context: If you don't have anything to do, you'll be idle and waste your time; whatever has come to you is a gift from God's pen.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
એમ વાત કરી હરિ, ત્યાર પછી પોતે પોઢિયા; 
સુણી વાત સતસંગીએ, અતિશે રાજી થિયા.
gujarati.context:
God has spoken His word; He then takes rest Himself.
The wise and the virtuous listen to His teachings with great attention.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પ્રભાતે ઊઠી પોતે, દયાળે દાતણ કર્યું; 
નાયા પછી નાથજી, જને હાર પહેરાવી છોગું ધર્યું.
gujarati.context: After the dawn, I arose by myself; fate has given me a hard time to bear.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
પછી જને જમાડિયા, પ્રભુને પ્રીત્યે કરી; 
જમી પોતે શ્યામળે, પછી સંત જમાડ્યા ભાવે ભરી.
gujarati.context: After getting tired and exhausted, one should dedicate their love to God; having done so, they themselves become a saint, filled with devotion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
એમ દિન દશ સુધી, લટકાળે લીલા કરી; 
પછી પોતે પધારિયા, પશ્ચિમદેશે શ્રીહરિ.
gujarati.context: This couplet describes a person who spent their youth in revelry and joy (લટકાળે લીલા કરી) until they grew old and eventually sought spiritual guidance (પછી પોતે પધારિયા).
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

gujarati.couplet:
એવી અનુપમ કરી લીલા, જેઠ સુદિ એકાદશી દને; 
લીલા કરાવી જેતલપુરે, ગંગાદાસ આ સજી જને.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the beauty of Lila (playfulness) that is unique to a particular day, Ekadashi, which brings joy and delight to those who experience it. It compares this joy to the playfulness that Gangadas, a legendary figure, brought to people in Jetpur.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 76: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Puruṣhottampaṇu Kahyu

transliteration.couplet:
Have Gujardharmā sant faratā, karatā Harinī vāratā; <RHYME_1>
Panchavrate pūrā shūrā, Prabhune sambhārtā.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: A peaceful and harmonious life is achieved when one's inner self (Gujardharmā) is at peace and God (Harinī) is pleased with one's good deeds. The five senses are fully satisfied, and the soul is united with the divine, bringing joy and contentment.

transliteration.couplet:
Teṇe manmā vichāriyu, hajī Nāthjī kem nāviyā; <RHYME_2>
Āj kāl karatā, darshan vinā din bahu giyā.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: The couplet asks when God will consider our heartfelt longing and grant us a meeting, as time passes and days go by without a glimpse of the divine. It is expressing the desire for a spiritual experience or darshan with God.

transliteration.couplet:
Em shoch karīne sant sūtā, tene swapnamā āvyā Hari; <RHYME_3>
Sakhā sange Shyāmaḷo, jāṇu padhāryā dayā karī.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: One who understands the suffering of others is considered a true saint, and God is pleased with their dreams. A friend's company brings joy to the heart, and compassion is always rewarded.

transliteration.couplet:
Shvet vastra paherī lerī, jāṇu āviyā ashve chaḍī; <RHYME_4>
Sant man magan thaī, kahe dhanya dhanya āj ghaḍī.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: Wear the white garment of cleanliness and purity, and also keep your mind pure. A saintly person is grateful for even a small bit of good fortune that comes their way.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek kahe Mahārājne me, gunjāhār paherāviyā; <RHYME_5>
Bāju kāju kunḍaḷ karī, fūlnā torā dharāviyā.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: The couplet is saying that just like a royal queen's palace has intricate decorations and patterns, similarly, the beauty of a woman is showcased through her jewelry and clothing. The speaker is highlighting the importance of adornment in enhancing feminine charm.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek kahe jāṇu chandan ghashī, charachyu mārā hāthshu; <RHYME_6>
Ek kahe jāṇu alabelāne, bheṭiyo bharī bāthshu.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: One says "chandan" (vermilion) is red, and I've got a broken hand; Another says "alabelāne" ( vermilion-red) is the color of our conversation.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek kahe jāṇu Nāthnā, charaṇ chhāpyā chhātie; <RHYME_7>
Ek kahe evī dīṭhī mūrati, te to navya jāy kahye.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: One says "I am the lord", but in reality, one is just a mere mortal; another claims they have seen God, but it's just a new idea being born.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek kahe me sakhā dīṭhā, sange sundar Shyāmne; <RHYME_8>
Em sante swapna māhī, dīṭhā pūraṇ kāmne.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: A friend says to me that beauty is not just physical appearance, but also inner virtues like Shyam; Meanwhile, I am busy dreaming of the ocean, and my goal is to fulfill all desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Prabhāte ūṭhī paraspar, vāt karavā lāgiyā; <RHYME_9>
Jāṇyu padhāryā vālyamo, sant sahunā dukh bhāngiyā.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: As morning dawns, each of us gets entangled in our respective concerns, and the winds of fate take us away. In this worldly life, we're left to struggle with the pangs of sorrow.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī nāhī jan jīvannī, vāṭ juve chhe sahu maḷī; <RHYME_10>
Em karatā padhāriyā, vālyamjī pote vaḷī.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: The couplet says that even the living don't know their own time of death, and it's like trying to hold a slippery fish; one must make the most of every moment, as the future is uncertain and fleeting.

transliteration.couplet:
Jevā dīṭhātā swapna māī, tevānā tevā padhāriyā; <RHYME_11>
Darshan daī dāsane, navalā te neh vadhāriyā.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: The mother of the dream is a gentle one who guides her child gently and lovingly. The darshan (meeting) with the Lord is like serving as a servant, where the soul surrenders its ego completely.

transliteration.couplet:
Jan sahu magan thayā, nīrkhī Naṭvar Nāthne; <RHYME_12>
Pāya lāgī pāsaḷe, vaḷī ūbhā joḍī hāthne.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a wise and noble person who has no attachment to worldly possessions or desires. They have let go of all attachments, leaving their hands free to serve others.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Prabhujī boliyā, jāo teḍāvo sarve janne; <RHYME_13>
Santne khabar karajyo, mar kare āvī darshanne.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context:
The couplet is asking to remember one's Lord and seek His guidance, knowing that all of existence will ultimately appear before Him.

One should be mindful of their thoughts and deeds, as they will be seen by the Lord after death.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī sāmbhaḷīne sarve āvyā, satasangī ne sant vaḷī; <RHYME_14>
Nāth nīrakhī haiye harakhī, lāgyā pāy Prabhune laḷī.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: All beings are lost in their own ways, but a true friend can guide them to the right path. One's own self is hard to understand, let alone others, only God knows our true nature.

transliteration.couplet:
Sant manḍaḷ sarve āvyā, beṭhā joī jīvanne; <RHYME_15>
Alabele amṛut draṣhṭe, joyā sarve janne.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that the path to enlightenment is open to all, and one can experience eternal life by following it. In essence, it highlights the universal nature of spirituality and the potential for self-realization through a righteous path.

transliteration.couplet:
Anant sukh āpyā vāle, kāpyā dukh dās taṇā; <RHYME_16>
Mīṭhī vāṇye bolī Mohan, rājī karyā sant ghaṇā.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: One's life is a mix of happiness and sorrow, with moments of calmness in between. A wise person like Mohan speaks sweetly to others and finds peace in their actions.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī divas vaḷate, āvī aval Ekādashī; <RHYME_17>
Satasangī nar-nārī sahu, rahyā vrat maḷī ṛuṣhi.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: The days pass swiftly, and only one Ekadashi remains; a devotee's vow is broken if they eat during this sacred day.

transliteration.couplet:
Jetalpurnī jāgyamā, manuṣhya to māyā nahi; <RHYME_18>
Pachhī Prabhujī virājiyā, taḍāgataṭe vaṭe jaī.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that even the wisest person (Jetelpurni) is not immune to being deceived by Maya (illusion), and only God's grace can lift them out of the cycle of life and death.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyā anant jan āviyā, lāviyā pūjā prītshu; <RHYME_19>
Ambar bhūṣhaṇ ange arapī, charaṇ chitavyā chittashu.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the infinite love and devotion (prītshu) that fills one's heart (chittashu), like a flood that overflows the banks of one's soul. It is a reminder to hold onto this inner light and let it guide us, rather than being consumed by worldly desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī sant shīkhanḍ ghasī, lāvyātā bhājan bharī; <RHYME_20>
Marajī joī Mahārājnī, sarve angmā arachā karī.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a peaceful and serene environment where a saintly person has settled, filling their plate with offerings from others. This saintly person is so generous that they fill everyone's needs, just like Maharani (the Great Queen).

transliteration.couplet:
Sundar hār sumannā, Prabhune paherāviyā; <RHYME_21>
Ponchī bāju kāju kunḍaḷ, gajarā torā dharāviyā.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: A beautiful bride is adorned with flowers, and her love is offered to the beloved God; just as a tender gourd is carefully lifted from the soil, so too are our hearts elevated by devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhūp dīp karī āratī, sahu laḷī pāye lāgiyā; <RHYME_22>
Pachhī Prabhujī gāmmā, ghoḍe chaḍī jamavā giyā.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context:
The couplet describes a worship ritual where incense and light are offered to God, seeking His divine presence.

In the village of Prabhujī's residence, the devotees have gone on a pilgrimage, carrying their offerings with them.

transliteration.couplet:
Jamī jīvan āviyā, nāyā pachhī nīrmā; <RHYME_23>
Choḷī chandan utāriyu, je charachyu hatu sharīrmā.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: A person's entire life is spent in vain pursuits, and they don't realize their true worth until death takes them away. Just as a red sandalwood leaf falls off the tree without being noticed, so too do we leave this world unnoticed.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī pahor pāchhale, vālo padhāryā vāḍiye; <RHYME_24>
Em sukh alabelaḍo, diye dāsne dāḍidāḍiye.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: In the past, good deeds were done with great effort, but now they are forgotten; similarly, a sweet dish is enjoyed with much labor, but its sweetness is soon forgotten.

transliteration.couplet:
Anant vāto tyā karī, suṇī sant sahu magan thiyā; <RHYME_25>
Pachhī sakhā sange Shyāmaḷo, mole malaptā āviyā.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a joyous reunion between friends Anant and Shyama after a long separation.

transliteration.couplet:
Jane tyā jāgaraṇ karyu, gāyā kīrtan ati ghaṇā; <RHYME_26>
Pāṭe besī pātaḷe, suṇyā pad sant taṇā.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: Worship God with devotion and loud chanting of His glory; and in the silence of meditation, find inner peace and tranquility.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Prabhujī boliyā, tame sāmbhaḷo harijan sahu; <RHYME_27>
Ati rahasya ekāntyanī, ek vālyapnī vāt kahu.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The divine voice is speaking directly to the soul of a humble Harijan, revealing profound secrets.

transliteration.couplet:
Ā sabhāmā āpaṇ sahunā, tejomay tan chhe; <RHYME_28>
Chhaṭā chhūṭe chhe tejnī, jāṇu prakaṭiyā koṭi indu chhe.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a person's inner beauty and goodness shining through, like a beacon of light. Their radiant nature is reflected in their actions, which are like a thousand suns shining brightly.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī kahu ek vāratā, sarve kīdhu āpaṇu thāya chhe; <RHYME_29>
Sukh dukh vaḷī jay parājay, yatkinchit je kahevāy chhe.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: Life's ups and downs are a natural part of existence, and everyone faces them; what matters is how we respond to them.

transliteration.couplet:
Je je āpaṇne navya game, te jīv kem shake karī; <RHYME_30>
Juvo sarve jaktamā, koṇ shake chhe fel ācharī.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: In a new game, one's own life is at stake; every moment counts.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī rītya āpaṇī, je jīvne nathī gamatī; <RHYME_31>
Jou chhu evā jīvne, chhe kenī kenī evī mati.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: Life is uncertain and unpredictable, like a traveler who has not fixed their destination.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene shodhī sāmaṭo, ek danḍ devā tān chhe; <RHYME_32>
Koī na prīchhe paracho, evu karavu māre nidān chhe.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: The wise and humble one is equal to God, and no one can be superior to them; whoever tries to dominate others will ultimately suffer the consequences.

transliteration.couplet:
Jevu amārā angmā, sukh-dukh rākhu chhu sahī; <RHYME_33>
Tevu jāṇajyo jaktamā, kahu satya emā sanshay nahi.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: As long as I have my beloved's touch, I can bear happiness and sorrow with equanimity. Without you, even a moment of truth would be uncertain.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī āpaṇe rākhiyā, ṣhaṭ rasnā vratmān; <RHYME_34>
Te di sarve jaktamā, kene khāvā na rahyu dhān.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: The couplet advises keeping one's desires in check, just like a farmer tends to his crops, and not indulging in pleasures that can lead to loss of wealth.

transliteration.couplet:
Je di ame chhānā rahyā, ane vaḷī vadhāryā kesh; <RHYME_35>
Te dinā ā bhū viṣhe, sahu nistej thayā naresh.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: When one's eyes are closed in sleep and hair is entwined with the wind, it's as if they're saying goodbye to this world. Meanwhile, their soul remains stuck in worldly desires, unable to escape.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī ame angmā, āṇyo hato mandvāḍ; <RHYME_36>
Te dāḍe ā jaktamā, bahu jīvno gayo bigāḍ.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: Life is like a fleeting dream, it soon vanishes; Just as the river's flow is short-lived, so are our lives.

transliteration.couplet:
Em jaṇāy chhe ekatā, mārā pinḍ brahmānḍmā maḷī; <RHYME_37>
Je hoy ā angmā, te brahmānḍmā hoy vaḷī.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: In oneness is the highest realization, and worldly attachment is a barrier to it. When one transcends worldly desires, they reach the state of divine consciousness.

transliteration.couplet:
Te māṭe tame sāmbhaḷo, satasangī sahu nar-nār; <RHYME_38>
Je je thāy chhe jaktamā, teno bījo nathī karanār.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one should cultivate good company and spiritual growth, just as a tree grows strong with nourishing soil.

transliteration.couplet:
Sukh dukh āve sarve bheḷu, temā rākhajyo sthir mati; <RHYME_39>
Jāḷavīsh mārā janne, vaḷī karīsh jatan ati.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: Life's joys and sorrows come and go, but a steady mind remains steadfast. One should not let the ups and downs of life disturb their mental balance.

transliteration.couplet:
Em karatā jo panḍ paḍashe, to āgaḷ sukh chhe ati ghaṇu; <RHYME_40>
Paṇ vrat ṭek jo ṭāḷasho to, bhogavasho sahu sahu taṇu.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: He who is happy with what he has, will always have an abundance of joy; similarly, one who is content with their food, will always have enough.

transliteration.couplet:
Nahi to tame nachint rahejyo, karavu tamāre kāī nathī; <RHYME_41>
Je maḷyā chhe tamane, te pār chhe Akṣharthī.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: If you're not mindful of your actions, others will dictate them for you, and your reputation will suffer as a result. But if you're wise, you'll recognize the value of self-control and avoid falling prey to external influences.

transliteration.couplet:
Em vāt karī Hari, tyār pachhī pote poḍhiyā; <RHYME_42>
Suṇī vāt satasangīe, atishe rājī thiyā.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: One's devotion to God is like a gentle breeze that lifts the soul, whereas worldly attachments weigh it down. In spiritual company, one becomes more tranquil and self-controlled.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī prabhāte ūṭhī pote, dayāḷe dātaṇ karyu; <RHYME_43>
Nāyā pachhī Nāthjī, jane hār paherāvī chhogu dharyu.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: The morning sun rises over one's head, and one should do good deeds with compassion.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī jane jamāḍiyā, Prabhune prītye karī; <RHYME_44>
Jamī pote Shyāmaḷe, pachhī sant jamāḍyā bhāve bharī.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: The couplet is about a devotee who has reached the Lord's doorstep (jamāḍiyā) and has been granted love (prītye karī). The devotee's heart is now overflowing with joy, like Shyāmaḷe's pot that's filled to brim.

transliteration.couplet:
Em din dash sudhī, laṭakāḷe līlā karī; <RHYME_45>
Pachhī pote padhāriyā, Pashchim-deshe Shrī Hari.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: In the morning's pure atmosphere, divine play unfolds; Lord Shri Hari is worshipped in the Western direction.

transliteration.couplet:
Evī anupam karī līlā, Jeṭh sudi Ekādashī dane; <RHYME_46>
Līlā karāvī Jetalpure, Gangādās ā sajī jane.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: The divine play is unmatched and unparalleled, celebrated on Ekadashi day with a sweet offering. The story of Jetalpur was created by Lord Krishna, known to the people as Gangadas's delight.
